text: WHAT A JOKE!! Just went to the St. Patricks day party... We have been hanging out  here for the last 6 years and have been to the party before. We haven't been to the party for a couple of years but this was a complete joke. NO IRISH FOOD, NO IRISH MUSIC, and Green Coors or Bud ???? They had food trucks serving hamburgers, and rented booths selling overpriced garbage. We paid $10 each for cover and paid $7 for draft beer?? Then we got ripped off for $40 for three burgers and fries from the food truck?? It used to be THEIR food and it used to be cool.  Now for the music. I have no idea who thought this up? Some guy on stage attempting to be a one man band trying to do mixed up covers of Eminem and other rap/ R&B radio crap... They used to have an excellent band that rocked!    Not sure who put this together, but the only thing Irish about this party was the green clothes.    Next year we will find a pub that is actually an IRISH pub... Good luck

Didn't have a very good experience.... Ordered some wings and told the bartender how I wanted them and when I got my order it was the exact opposite! No apology , no can I get you a new order! In fact he didn't care, I had to ask if I could get the order I wanted and all Eric said was "if it's wrong it's wrong!" Really where did you learn your customer service????? Even after I paid my bill and tipped him he NEVER SAID SORRY OR THANK YOU! I'll never go back! And I'm in the industry !!

We came during happy hour. Not sure on what all the different beers cost normally but our black and tans were $2.50 and the food was half off. We made the mistake of ordering nachos and chicken fingers, the nachos were pretty grande and would have been enough for two on their own. They come with chili. I like chili on my nachos.   Most of the people in the bar were ravenously feeding the slot machines, I felt a little out of place not slapping the buttons in front of my face.   Staff was polite and attentive. I'll definitely go back as long as happy hour is on.

Me and my husband both work in the service industry him as a bartender and i as a cocktail waitress at a 5star casino.We both played $40 and tipped well and couldnt get a single comped drink!!!what a joke!We dont gamble our whole paycheck away,just a lesiurely night out to play a couple bucks so I understand not comping multiple drinks but one round??We were blown away and will never return bc of that and the HORRIBLE attitude and service by Eric the bartender.We were prepared to tip heavily and instead payed our tab with their tip.Instead of Three Angry Wives you ended up with Two Angry Customers.....

Certain items are good, breakfast for the most part. I've tried to go several times because there close to the house and wanted a regular spot. Whenever I called to order I was treated as though I was a bother and felt very rushed. Each time I went in I was treated with a lot of attitude, and for all the wrong reasons! Word on the street is that there a bit on the racist side........ Don't let the one black bartender fool you, I felt like I was in 1890
Nice seating specially the couch. The food was okay, I had the veggie platter and chicken wings. I like the fact that it was not too noisy, you can still carry a conversation here.

Good atmosphere but the food is overpriced for what you get. I was disappointed to find that the pita pizza I ordered was very small for the price you pay for it. Usually pub food is great for the price but this place falls short. Bartenders are friendly though and keep checking on you. Overall, I would come back to have a drink but not have a meal.

Come see Eric swing shift!!! If your a gamer he takes care of you. Unlike most bars in this yuppie area. Ur good to him and he's good to you! . As far as food...every thing is great. The angry nachos are huge. U can't go wrong.
Fish n chips, crispy, tasty fries not cooked in same oil as fish :) crunchy n tasty. Large sandwich n wrap menu, looks like some big burgers

I rarely write reviews, however, our experience here was so unpleasant that I wanted to share it with potential customers.   My experience on day shifts has been okay, although I agree with Brent V. that the service has been slow, and "uncaring". However, the other evening my wife and a family friend went in to get a late night bite on the Graveyard shift. The main area is smoky to the point of causing nausea, and we went into the "sealed" dining room. My wife and her friend went up to the Bartender, Dan, to ask if it would be okay if we ate in the dining area; we'd be willing to pick up the food at the bar. I waited in the dining area.   What I overheard was possibly the most insulting bit of customer service that I have ever experienced. After my wife asked if we could eat in the dining area, Dan said, "You two are in the wrong place, you need to leave!" After he reiterated his feeling that the women had no business in the establishment (this conversation took less than 30 seconds), I decided I would go see what was going on. I asked Dan, "What is going on?", to which he said, "Are you with those two girls?". I said, "Yes" and Dan said, "You need to leave, you're 86'd".   I was flabbergasted! I assured Dan that I would be making my displeasure known, and he said, "Good luck with that".  Ordinarily, I would approach the owner about this type of behavior, however, short of terminating Dan, there isn't anything that "The Wives" could do to assuage my displeasure. Maybe he feels because he had a decent sized crowd around the video poker bar (I'm sure due to his charming personality) that he is untouchable. I don't know. All I know is that until the day comes that I hear, or receive an email that Dan has been summarily terminated I will not return to that establishment, and I will tell everybody I know about my experience with him.

Stopped by for breakfast... Service was spot on and the food was good.  Tried the corn beef hash which was basic but tasty.  The sample platter was a good potion of fried food and good as well.  Great spot for a quick meal at a decent price.  Enjoyed the TV's and atmosphere.  Will return...

Pretty standard pub, and kind of expensive.  I didn't go during happy hour (mistake), and I ordered the fish n chips (another mistake). Ended up paying a bit too much for food that was only okay in a place with a decently cool "pub vibe". However the beer was cold, and they had smithwick's on tap. (one of my fav's)

Went here recently and the service was absolutely terrible.  Took them 30-40 minutes to get me my second beer and then anther 30-40 for me to get my check picked up.  It would be one thing if the waitress was clearly apologetic, the bar understaffed, and chaos unfolding for the poor folks staffing the place.  Unfortunately, the waitress didn't say a word as she dropped the beer off after my wait and didn't say a word about the delay in taking my check/card away.  No "Here's your beer, very sorry about the wait..." nothing.  What a joke.  Beer is decently priced.

One of my favorites in las Vegas been going here for 5 years. The staff is super friendly and the food portions are awesome. Also the lobby and 5 TV makes this one of the best places to watch sports in Las Vegas!

New to LV and found an Irish Pub just down the street from me. Good Irish fair and although I never tried the mussels, they sure looked good. Drinks are reasonable, their happy hour runs for a bit and the machines at the bar never took all my money. The leather seating area is a nice touch and great for socializing or a casual business meeting over a drink.   If you ever find yourself with an issue, management seems to have an open mind and prefers resolution over sour grapes.  They've lost my business due to a recent experience, but your mileage may vary greatly. I hope it does anyway...

Slow service, actually felt sorry for the waitress as she was all alone. Sat next to the bar and tried to order food from the bartender "I'm not your waitress" was the response I received. Food was decent, service not so much. I won't be back.

Three angry wives has a bar that my husband and I have been to as well as another side where you can bring kids or just be away from the bar atmosphere. The bar is great....there are plenty of TVs to watch the games, sofas to relax on and plenty of regular seating. The food is great and the beer of course is good. We've tried the white mussels, the fish and chips, and the veggie panini, which were all great with the panini probably being the best sandwich I've had. The other side though isn't as great. There are only a couple TVs so it would be hard to watch the game here with our kids. Also it has a weird musty,  sweaty smell. Of course the good and beer are still great, but I wish the other side felt the love like the bar side which was why only the 4 stars.  I'm not 100 percent sure I would bring my kids back which unfortunately means I won't be able to go as much as I'd like.
Food is great but the waitress IQ is lower then a rock. The bar tender had to check on us 3 times while the waitress was messing with her hair! Again Great food!!!!!
Loved watching the Pats game there. Bartenders were great and the BBQ chicken salad is my favorite!

Cant say much about this place. Tried twice and was no good. Went during breakfast and the food sucked went again with the wife during the later hours and the food was worse. Plus the place smells like an ash tray. No thank you.

So I discovered you guys at 3-4 am this morning when I got off work(too tired to drive or move) on UberEATS. Your Pretzel bites, muscles, and then WINGSSSSS were SOOO BOMB! I now know where I will be ordering from when I get off work! (Because it's always 4 am approx and your hours work w my schedule which is AMAZING) seriously, keep it up. Love your food.

First off I want to say every time I come here the service is great. The staff is always friendly and the service is quick. The food is absolutely delicious. The Mediterranean sampler is amazing. Best food at a pub I've ever had. The drinks are also very reasonably priced. Good place to fill your belly with food and drink.

Reggie and Shannon are THE best. The service and atmosphere of this bar is great. True Irish hospitality. Gaming, food and great cocktails. If you are in the area and looking for a good time stop by. Lucky to have this bar in the neighborhood.

Second visit to this restaurant and impressed with the menu.  For a neighborhood bar and grill, this place has a very extensive menu and the best fish and chips that we have had for a long time.  The kitchen is very accommodating in allowing me to order off the dinner menu for lunch.  Friendly service and one of the best parts. . . . . Notre Dame fans!!  We will be back.
This is a great place!  The food is good, and reasonably priced, and the lounge is very comfortable if you want to just hang out.  I have been going there for years, and will keep going back!

This is a very unconventional place. You have to play at least a hundred dollars  in the machines  to get a drink comped. After I had already payed my seventy five dollar bill and spent 40 dollars on the machines , they couldn't even comp one drink. When I asked why the self proclaimed owner Danny ( i dont think hes the owner) said it was his right who gets comped and 86'd me.  Very  strange experience. It was like dealing with the soup nazi. Very angry people indeed.   There are some positives despite my bad experience.  The food is  really  good a lil pricey though. The music was pretty good a nice mix a rap and alternative if that is your style. Mostly a conservative crowd here so if you have liberal views your not going to be very welcomed.   The customer service ruined what could have been a promising place.  Id say go with steiners, bootleggers, pt's , instant replay or another irish pub.

Bar side is focused on players only. They have nice big screen TV's, but will Not turn on the sound, as it "upsets the gamer's". Yep, that's what we were told. Ok, turn off the Tv's and just stop pretending to be a sports bar! That is all. . .

About as authentic as a shamrock shake. Ordered the corned beef and cabbage they gave us rubbery shaved deli meat two big quarters of watery unflavored cabbage and bland mashed potatoes from what I imagine came from a box. The beer list was pathetic only offering 3 americanized irish beers on tap including guinness draught not even offered at room temperature. Gross at best.

Had breakfast here one day.  I had the TAW Breakfast Burrito, it was huge and very tasty.  The service was good, and the beer was cold.  I'll have to stop here again some time on my way out to hike the Red Rock Canyon trails.
Trying the breakfast.  Having eggs Benedict and husband having corn beef and hash breakfast.  Food was very good.  Love the 2 for 1 coupons
Great pub food, nice staff, a lot of British food, clean, haven't gamed there yet but I hear the machines are good, they have a non smoking section.

One of the nicer bars in town. Decent bar food, great drinks, and lots of tvs to watch sports. If you don't mind random waves of rich, 4x4 douche bags, go for it. The bartenders and waitresses are great and very friendly!

Whether you are a drinker, diner, sports fan, or love to play Golden Tee this is a great place to be. Typically, we will go for dinner, however lately, we have been there to watch sports.   The food is always great. We especially love the Patty Melt and Nachos.  The service has never been bad. Tina, London, Reggie and the rest of the crew remember your names and look out for you. Always checking to make sure that you have everything you need.  The atmosphere is different depending on where you sit and when you come. The lounge area with the comfy couches is a great place to watch the big game.  Make sure you check for the coupons in the Summerlin View for specials and if you are of Irish descent or Irish for a day, you MUST go and enjoy their St. Patty's Day celebration. It is big, bawdy, and full of fun.

I absolutely love this place! It is by far my favorite hang out, and as a local bartender myself I have spent many hours visiting bars all across Vegas. They have the best staff in town along with awesome food and entertainment. Definitely a place to try if your not already a regular!

I almost hate to write a review because I don't want anyone else to come here :(  I never suggest meeting a guy there because if it doesn't work out, but they like 3AW, it will be RUINED for me -_- It is the best place to go hide after a long day...I try other places but I find I go back here over and over.  Heffeweisen is super cold. Reggie is my favorite bartender in Vegas. I'm surprised that some of the other reviews were not favorable towards the staff, I find them to be mostly awesome, but maybe because they are familiar with me.  However....if there is a party in the couch area, and you don't want to gamble, you can't sit at the bar, so you are pretty much forced to eat at that weird side bar thing and stare at the party that is going on that you werent invited to. It's awkward. Maybe go when there isn't a party.  I only ever get the Cobb salad or steak, hold all sides, double mushrooms. I can't really comment on anything else, as I go to throw them back, not eat.

Played max bet at a decent pace for an hour. Won forty bucks and had two beers and my girlfriend, who was not playing, had one. Got bill expecting to pay for her drinks. My two domestic beers were in the bill too. Didnt comp me for playing.

After being driven out onto the hot mean streets of Boca Park by the outstandingly bad service at Wahoo's Tacos (see previous review) I stumbled into a cool oasis know as Three Angry Wives Pub.  There I met an angel disguised as Debbie the bartender who soothed me with ice cold beer and piping hot pretzel bites.  Once revived and renewed, I was pleasantly surprised by the check -- half price from 2-6pm.  I recommend you go here when you find yourself in a similarly desperate situation.

I recently moved to the area and ran across this pub. I decided to stop in for a bite to eat. I was really surprised at how reasonable the food was and how good it tasted! The pub has a nice vibe, mostly due to the manager/bartender who is very attentive and genuinely likes his customers.  I would have no problem recommending this pub as I plan on returning myself.

Staff was amazing. Food was ok, lots of options. In the middle of the second quarter of the game we went to watch, the owner wanted to watch something different. We would have spent much more time and money had they not changed the channel. Will not be returning.

Not to jump to any conclusions, but this is our second time here and the service is still the worse unless you are of a certain skin tone. There were two other tables around us and they were being waited on very attentively while we had to ask for a menu and get ignored while we just sat there.  The table that arrived after us got plate settings, menus, and drinks even though we were there at least 15 minutes before. We paid for our drinks (I had to walk up to the bar to order and pay, while the other tables got served) and went to a real local place that knows service. We gave Three Angry Wives a second chance but unfortunately they failed again.

Great locals pub with bar-top gaming.  The servers and bartenders are the friendliest people in town.  Quick service, GREAT FOOD, and a decent selection of tap beers and spirits.  Seriously, I don't understand why there are so many negative reviews!  I guess the one thing I can say is that their Internet jukebox is a bit wonky...

This is a regular stop for the Mrs and I in Vegas.  We always go during Happy Hour, with 1/2 priced appetizers and drinks.  We both love the wings - the best in town. If you want a side of fries, I suggest you order them separately (larger amount received that way).  A decent selection of beers.  Can't beat the Happy Hour prices!

My husband, son, and I went to this place for dinner on 5/23/14.  I ordered the chicken and rib plate ($19) and a hard cider.  I asked for dark meat which shouldn't be a problem since white meat seems to be more popular. The cider and the Caesar side salad were crisp, cold, and delicious. (The reason for upping my review to two stars.)  That's where the positives stop.  After a pretty long wait, the server comes to our table saying, "I have good news and bad news.  The good news is that your order is ready.  The bad news is that we are out of baked potatoes and it will be over an hour until they're ready."  This is an "Irish" pub.  I'm thinking that 6:15 on a Friday evening would be a good time to expect a higher demand for baked potatoes.    About ten minutes later, our previously ready and nothing more than warm meal arrived.  The ribs seemed oven-cooked with barbeque sauce poured on just prior to serving.  The vegetables were bland. The chicken was white meat.  When I mentioned this, the server said, "I asked for dark."  No offer to replace it with the correct item.  It was dry and chewy, so I left it unbeaten.    When she brought our check, it had an 18% gratuity already figured into the total.  We are good tippers for good service always figuring it based on the value not the reduced amount when using a coupon. IT is pretty presumptuous to have a tip amount selected and added into the total on the bill.  Based on the nothing special food, less than caring service, and preconceived notion that their customers won't tip without bing required to, Five Angry Wives just lost the business of One Angry Wife.

I met a friend for a quick bite to eat after work.  The service is always so-so in the bar area. We found a high-top table but it took awhile before we were acknowledged for drinks and had to ask for a menu.  We shared the Grilled Greek and chips/salsa.   The chips/salsa came with nacho cheese and home made salsa. The salsa was average and the cheese tasted like a true nacho cheese.  The Grilled Greek came with pita bread, gyro meat, tomatoes, cucumber, artichoke hearts, feta cheese, and tzatziki sauce. The pita bread was soft and warm. The rest of the items were about average in taste.  I'm sure they have better items on the menu but the service needs to improve.

Looked online to contact support regarding my visit. Not available.  Had an issue with my funds available card at atm--asked Derik (on duty  bartender) for assistance-leaving tender assisted me -as derik  did not have interest in my assistance?  I watched him carefully after that-very short with other guests- I then tested him with a question on my gaming question-VERY SHORT with answer-and mind you not busy-as I know what busy is-I was obnoxiously (with intent) looking at him for 'maybe' another question-he did not even look my may?? As a long time bartender- I was quite obviously the next 'in line' to attend to-I then had to wait for the bar back-of which was above and beyond amazing-to ask the bartenders name since he never introduced himself , AS SOON AS HEARD THAT-Derik asked if he could help me with anything? Pahleeez-there are soooo many other applicants that know how attend and proceed with accepted customer relations-this guy DID NOT! I have NEVER posted as such-but this was absolutely unacceptable service in Vegas -in general! I am in hopes that this establishment finds employees with higher standards as there are many out there that would have allowed me the comfort and satisfaction to stay longer and play-he just pissed me off so bad from the start-watch your cameras and see the mood change at his arrival-

There are plenty of good neighborhood bars in Las Vegas, and this is one of them. My husband and I stopped in for lunch while running errands in the area, and we sure are glad we did.  We sat in the back dining area, and my only complaint is that it was super dark. It was hard to read the menu, and we had no luck at all reading the beer list that was sitting on the table. Good thing Miller Lite is a staple at most bars (like it was here), so we didn't have to ask for a rundown of our choices. (I opted for iced tea, but my husband had a couple of drafts.)  My husband had the fish sandwich, which was really good. Lightly battered cod served with cheese, lettuce, and tomato. I liked my sandwich even better. The corned beef and sub slaw is like a lighter version of a reuben. Although I didn't think I'd like this on a sub roll, the bread was great (nice and chewy), and the corned beef was about the best I've ever had. We both got fries, which were fine, and I had a nice crisp pickle, although they left that off my husband's plate.  Service was good, and the prices were fair. And it looks like they have half-price beers and apps for happy hour, which is a bonus. Although it's a little far from my house, I think I'll be stopping in again when I'm in the area. And maybe next time I'll schedule our errands to coincide with happy hour!

My boyfriend and I came here for a little cheat night after a hard week's work.  I'm a huge fan of pretzel bites and these ones did not disappoint.  Pretzel bites tossed with garlic butter and salt, served with cheese sauce ($6.99).  I'm drooling just thinking of these.   I ordered the rodeo burger - onion rings, cheddar cheese, and bbq sauce ($8.99).  Delicious!!  I chose onion rings for my side.  They were soooo good; my boyfriend couldn't keep his paws off of them.  He ordered the "Get Some" burger - american cheese, fries, onion straws, jalapenos, and nacho cheese ($9.99) with french fries as his side.  Also good, but not as good as my onion rings.  The bar was packed so we didn't get to sit there, only downside =(  Service was good.  Pretzel bites, two burgers, two beers, and two redbull vodkas came out to around $55, can't remember exactly.

Just stopped by to try this place out and grab a bite and a brew. It was mid afternoon on Saturday so we found a great spot at the bar and jumped into the video poker first.  The bartender suggested we try the cheeseburger chowder and I was glad we did.  It was good, but what's not to like about meat and cheese in a bowl  Next we spilt a salad that was not only large, but delicious.   Some kind of Greek thing with gyro meat, salami, peppercinis, tomatoes.....all good stuff for sure.     Beer were good to, so I figure we will be back again soon.

Good service, good food, good beer, and textbook Americanized Irish pub feel.  If I have to go to Boca Park for happy hour, this is where I usually try to steer the event.  I like the laid back atmosphere and playing a little keno while I sip my Guiness.  Not much else to tell...

My favorite Happy Hour spot in Summerlin!  Love the staff, the food, the music and the regulars are hilarious to evesdrop on!  Single girls can hang out with bartender backup....no freaks on a leash here!  Did I mention the food?  Happy  hour has half price appetizers!  Greek plate ROCKS!

We go to T-A-W once a month or so and the food is usually good; wings, burgers and the Irish specialties are very good. However the 'Salmon Special' last Friday was awful. Nice size piece of fish that I ordered grilled. Waaaay over cooked and dried out. It was accompanied with mashed potatoes (instant I'm sure) and frozen broccoli (luke warm). We usually sit at the bar and the bartenders are very efficient and friendly. If we sit in the dining room the servers are friendly and most know the menu. The service in the bar and dining room is good. I guess it depends what time of day you drop in. We'll  go back but i'll not be ordering the fish except for the fish and chips which is outstanding.

They should rename this place 2 Angry Bartenders! We went in on a Friday night, it was so smoky and a quarter full of patrons. Only 2 out of 3 of us were gambling and the bartenders were very upset we had the nerve to sit at their machines. The first big buff blonde man was so rude and walked away before we could even order. The 2nd bartender Briton(?) was more interested in talking about his b'ahi religion than mixing a drink. We put over $60 into the machines, and were going to order food until he started belittling my girlfriend. We asked for the check and were charged for all 3 drinks...when we questioned why we were not comped at least one drink he literally snatched the $20 from my other girlfriends hand and said " we are done here" If you like to be treated like crap on a girls night out by rude bartenders in a smoky half empty bar this would be the place for you! So bizarre... as the customer service was a zero. I would give this place zero stars if I could!

The only reason for four stars rather than five is the smokey atmosphere. The bartenders are all top notch, and I even witnessed probably one of the most classy ways of cutting someone off for having too much to drink (kindly asking if he'd like some water or something else non-alcoholic and its on the house). The reason for the review is the food, huge portions, prepared fast and no problem with asking for extra rolls, butter, etc. Genuinely nice staff and overall atmosphere. I highly recommend if you need food late at night and don't want fast food in the area.
Came to watch Hockey and have a couple drinks....no sound and was told they don't turn it up. It disturbs the gamers. Why bother having the TV's. won't be back
Excellent! Food is great, drinks are great and it is super affordable! Huge portions of food so don't order too much!

One in Italian for my fellows  Service is nice. Music is enjoyable.  Nice atmosphere.  Portions are really big and prices are reasonable.  Free wifi is a pleasant surprise especially if you tare on your own

The entrance has a sign that says the non smoking entrance is on the rear end of the restaurant. So my bf and I walk through this rocky side area with shards of broken glass to get to the "rear" side. There are two doors but only one of them has a handle. I opened the door with the handle only to find a surprised and confused kitchen worker telling me that the rear entrance was removed some time ago and that we need to enter through the front....great. So we walk through the rocks and glass again to the entrance. Once we got in, the nonsmoking room was acutally nice and the food itself was decent, we got Mac and cheese bites, shepard's pie, and white wine mussels. They really need to remove that sign at the entrance though. Such an easy fix.

Arrived at 1 on a Friday to avoid the lunch rush. Food was placed in front of me :50 minutes later :( "Sorry about the wait, all these people (13) had to eat before you."  Not true: I was seated before 11 of them.  Ordered the crunchy shrimp wrap (spinach tortilla). Not bad tasting, but the cream cheese (yep) does NOT work. The fat in the cream cheese coats the tongue and blocks the subtle flavors of the shrimp and veggies from coming through. I tasted cream cheese and the green onions. Great mouth feel with the shrimp coating and crispy cuke pieces.  I will go back and try something else.  Low marks for long wait, surliness, and poor recipe development.

This is my "Cheers." Debbie always knows what we order by drink and food! best chicken nachos in town,again,don't miss happy hour,very worthwhile. Never been during St. Pat's cuz it's a nuthouse and I can't deal with that many drunk bastards in one loci. My man loves the wings, the kiddo loves the potato skins, and if I don't get the big ass chicken nachos, it's usually a cold day in hell!!! love this place, we go about every two weeks :)

Great Happy hour 2-6 M-F 1/2 price beer and apps. Great service from Chad. Found this place while waiting to go to dinner and was so impressed we made a return the next day. Wings are good but pretzel bites even better. Pass on the mac n cheese bites though. Definite stop on the next trip to LV.

Best Bar Food in Vegas.  Draft beers kept perfect. Personal service from guys like Reggie and Eric make this a reliable location for just about anything.  Not a gambler so I can't speak to the play at the bar but the kitchen and bartenders always deliver.
Came here with my roommates for dinner and drinks. Chill spot, good food, and decent prices.

Never eaten there because the place always smells like a bathroom and don't bother playing stuff that you want on the jukebox because the bartender will turn it off until you leave and then once you leave he'll delete all the songs that you put on,sorry for putting in Merle Haggard and Willie Nelson I thought it was a lot better than the rap crap playing. There are so many better bars around to go visit like the Martini down the street or Frank's Tiki Room or the Bar on Durango or......

Wow! Been sitting here for over an hour waiting for the sandwich I ordered. Still nothing. This is unacceptable! They need more help and new management! Too bad. I will not be back soley due to the food not arriving.
My favorite hang in all Las Vegas.  Stiff drinks, great unpretentious food.  Always have a good time.

Okay here goes. This is very much a dilemma. I love this place. I've been coming here for years, not quite a regular but I go there often. Today it was a shitshow. Don't get me wrong I love the bartenders; I love Debbie I love Reggie today I met the worst bartender ever. Sat at the bar by myself; a woman came and sat next to me to play a machine. She bought me a drink. WHen the bartender brought it over he charged for one because she was playing the machine. A little while later she tried to buy another round of drinks and he charged her for both. She asked why because she was playing machine. He told her that she wasn't playing, that the credits were still the  same as it was. I spoke up and said but she has been playing she hasn't been winning or losing staying pretty much equal his reply this is not a casino. I was kinda shocked, never experienced  that in this establishment before. Then while sitting there a friend of mine showed up so I bought her a drink price $9. A little while later she want another one and purchased it it was only $7. So she question him (same bartender) he said that the bartenders really don't know the prices and a double is $9 in a single a $7. Nobody ordered a double. He may think that we are stupid but we are in the industry.  I would have to say about 80% of the population here in Vegas work in the industry, I know when you punch it in the computer the price is there, so you don't need to be idiot to know the price. Like I said in a dilemma, love this place but extremely disappointed.

We liked it.  The seating is nice. We got a small table along a wall with comfy, deep chairs. Every seat has a great view of the televisions, so if you are there to watch a game you are in luck.  The food selection is pretty standard, but has interesting names and unique names. The beer selection has a lot of room to grow.  We will be back, as I want this place to blow me away. I imagine that a good night here is GREAT!!

Service kills this place. I love St. Patty's Day here, and the food is typically enjoyable...but they're not very aware of incoming patrons. Love it here! The food is ALWAYS awesome, beer is cold and staff is amazing! Erin and Kandy are so cute together behind the bar! Laurisa is such a great server, she always knows our drinks and is very attentive! If your in the area you need to check this bar out!

Nice looking Irish pub in a strip mall. Food was good and the menu has plenty of choices but don't try to sit at the bar unless you're a "high roller". The bartender will chase you off. I even told her I was going to put money in the machine but she said it's for regulars.  I just can't bring myself to come back and give them a second chance even though I live a block away.  There are much better choices in the area.  Maybe they should take a look at their average review score and re-evaluate how they run the bar area.
I needed a NE Patriots bar in Vegas, and I found it. Good team spirit and raffles during the game! Go Pats!

Decent pub for decent food while watching a game. I like how there are multiple areas: a dining room behind glass to avoid gaming noise and smoke, a lounge area with couches to watch the game in comfort, and bar/cocktail table seating for a final option. And of course, the bar has built-in gaming for those who feel so inclined.  Service was okay- our waitress was friendly and checked in on us regularly, seemed to be the only one working a dinner rush on a Thursday which was a bit odd. There was another guy running around clearing tables and greeting people who seemed a little overwhelmed or distracted, and didn't follow up after bringing us our first drinks, but the majority of our service was provided by the waitress- I think her name was Kandi?  Had a BOGO coupon for dinner entrees from a local publication. I went for the grilled chopped and topped greek salad- plentiful portion, surprisingly good pita for a bar, lots of fresh veggies, and  waitress was happy to give me both the greek feta and the bleu cheese dressings on the side to pick and choose which one went best. Only criticism is that there was very little meat on the salad, portion was more similar to bacon topping on a salad rather than a main protein for an entrée. BF opted for the corned beef and cabbage plate, which was also a giant portion, and again, better quality than expected. Sides were a side salad (also fresh), and mashed potatoes, which were super creamy. I kept stealing bites when he wasn't looking (he saw anyway, but the portion was huge so he didn't mind).  Overall this is a place I would return to- but only armed with another BOGO coupon. While quality is better than expected for bar food, prices are considerably higher too. Not a place I expect to drop $50 for dinner for two and two drinks.

Just wanted to have a beer and relax, met at the bar by a bartender with an attitude and no customers service skills, 40 something, white male, bb cap. Immediately relocated to lounge area and met a waitress who helped us. Not returning. ...

Some friends suggested this spot after our adventure hunt we had all day. We need to chill and have a drink.  Once you walk in its soo cozy, if you don't want to sit at the bar they have some SUPER comfortable couches facing multiple tv's with sports playing. Maybe they felt really comfy cause we just finished a scavenger hunt in the city and we were dead.  I just had one beer a smithwicks ale. I will admit I was babysitting my drink but the whole time we were there my drink stayed COLD! The waitress was very attentive and kept coming to check on us. She kept making fun of my hubby cause he got a water bahaha. I wasn't really hungry so I didn't order any food. I do want to come back cause my friends and hubby said their beer battered fries are the best. What I'm really impressed with is the bathroom. Now once you walk in the Lassie's restroom there's nothing too special. But when I finish washing my hands I also keep my paper towel so I don't touch the handle with clean hands. BUT then I saw this sign and it says to place your foot on a metal plate below and you use your foot to slide the door open! See the pictures I posted! I'm such a germaphob I know but every bathroom should have this!!

Always excellent service. The bartenders are great and the food is actually really delicious, everything tastes really fresh and they have a lot to chose from on their menu. They also serve food 24/7 which is great also bc not a lot of places in Summerlin do. You can go in or order on Uber eats. Zack is my favorite bartender, so sweet and attentive.
Stopped in on a quiet Tuesday afternoon to enoy happy hour.  Excellent service, decent bar food, and great prices!!  Love the comfy couches for lounging!!  See you again soon!!

My family and I have been regulars here for many years. The food and drinks are always consistent. Especially if you're craving bar food. The only down side is that the prices have gone up over the years. Even though it's a little pricey it's our fall back eatery.
I went to this  establishment Monday August 11,2014 for dinner.  I ordered their meat loaf.   I was very sick after eating their food.   I would not eat at this restaurant ever again!

So, we went to the St. Patrick's Day event at 3 Angry Wives. (For some reason, I keep wanting to call it Fourth of July, I don't know what's up with that).  I don't know what I expected, but I was a bit underwhelmed. $10 entry for what?  For a few outside tables/chairs, some beer vendors (just regular stuff), and a band that would play one song, stop for 20 minutes, play another song, and so on and so forth?  I think I'd rather buy a $10 burger- at least I'd get some satisfaction from that.  It was cool enough seeing all of the people dressed in green, but that's about it.  I don't know that I'm inspired to return for a meal.

Overall, this place is great.  However, every once in awhile, there are some patrons that come there that are screaming and yelling and partying in a bar that is more of a chill place.  They have a great St Patty's Day celebration and know how to throw a party, but they also know how to have the cool, lounge type of bar atmosphere which I like.  I usually go in there on Sundays and its a great place to hang with friends, eat some good grub and have a beer.  I go there to do homework since I need the white noise to make me concentrate and its great.  Lots of TVs, video poker, a few arcade games and the staff is super friendly.  If you're looking for a cool pub to hang with some friends and enjoy a few beers, this is definitely the place for you.  Enjoy!

This bar is great... that is, if you're an attractive woman under the age of 30 or you can bench over 350lbs.  Seriously, if you don't fit this criteria, you will be ignored by the steriod infused bartenders.  This is a serious flaw and the owner needs to take a hard look at it.  There are fairly heavy gamblers like myself that will be completely turned off by the non-existent customer service.  There's one more criteria that will get you a drink, if you're a female employee.  For example, I was at the bar, gambling the max amount every hit.  Both wannabe jock bartenders looked at my empty beer at least three times each as they checked in with the female employee three seats down on every pass.  I don't even think she was gambling.  This is outrageous.  I spent a few hundred dollars and had to ask them every time for another beer.    The other issue is there are virtually no comps for gamblers (unless of course you meet the aforementioned criteria).  You have to go out of your way to get a free beer, no free food and I literally only racked up $3 in free machine play after betting the max at a fast rate for over two hours.    To the owner... your team needs to focus less on comparing MMA stories, less on trying to get in the female employees pants, less on trying to appear like a tough guy, and more on basic customer service.  Never walk by a gambling customer, look at his empty beer and ignore it.  Gamblers are your bread and butter, not showing off that you've doubled your dose of steriods.

We visit TAW at least once a week since it's right in our neighborhood.  We always have great service and we have our favorite food too.  My boyfriend loves the Dugan's Skinny appetizer which is fresh veggies and spinich dip.  The nachos are HUGE and very good.  I also recommend the sliders and the rosemary roast beef dip!  So yummy!

On a quick trip to Vegas, three of us opted to forgo the $11 half-hearted pours of mixed drinks at the Mirage, and drove to The Summerlin area up North to get some local flavor.  Three Angry Wives Irish Pub caught our eye, just on the name alone. We walked in and it took a few minutes for our eyes to adjust to the dim lit room...which was great. The atmosphere was great.  We forgot about Vegas still allowing smoking in their bars, and there were plenty of smokers and cigar smokers drinking and playing games, but the air system made it very comfortable...in fact, it wasn't really noticeable after a while (great job).  The service was great...very friendly, and energetic. Our server told us it was happy hour and appetizers were 1/2 off. We had to try the chicken nachos...$4.99.  Every head in the place turned as the over-sized mountain of melted mexican munchies were delivered to our table. And the three of us weren't sure if we could finish the foothill-sized plate of flavor...so the back up plan would be to climb them and repel down the other side just to work off the calories.  Even a local diner came over and commented on the huge portion...as she snapped off a picture. They were not only plentiful, but delicious. They should come served with a velvet rope and stanchions to keep the onlookers at bay and crowds of gawkers orderly. A must order!  I can't say enough about the frosty cool beverages, the atmosphere and the service. These nachos will soon be a must-see attraction in Vegas, right up there with the Bellagio Fountains.

Two more angry customers.  The cigar-smoking, loud-mouthed and despicable Notre Dame football fan who I presume is the owner of this bar was unbelievably inhospitable to me and Misti Y. in the following ways:  1. Blowing plumes of cigar smoke in our general direction when he saw that we weren't cheering for his team, but instead for Michigan in a concurrent game. 2. Changing the channel on the TV directly in front of us from the Michigan-Nebraska game we were watching to the blowout game between Texas A&M and Auburn without warning, care or apology. 3. "I am tired of having this conversation with you - turn up the volume!" we heard him say impatiently to one of the servers. 4. We were literally smoked out, tuned out, drowned out, and screamed out. Never before have we experienced such persecution at a bar.  For the record, this was our 5th visit to Three Angry Wives for food and drink, but our first encounter with the 'owner'. It was certainly our last visit, as it is clear that customers will always take a backseat to the owner's desires. Avoid this bar (especially on College Football Saturdays) and especially if the owner is present. Your experience will be ruined, yet all stereotypes of obnoxious Notre Dame fans will be confirmed and fully verified.  There are dozens of other bars in the area who deserve your business more.

10:30 pm, Monday ordered online to go...Hawaiian pizza and Rosemary Dip, both cost $11 each;   The Rosemary Dip was very good, served hot with lotsa roast beef and Swiss cheese with carmelized onion on a chibatta roll and Rosemary au jus for dipping.   The pizza, a different reaction...Compare to Taco Bell's 'pizza', this pizza is the same size and is accompanied by a salad; the salad is romaine lettuce, some croutons and a hint of shredded cheese with your choice of dressing (I chose the Caesars salad). The pizza is heavy with cheese, hiding the other ingredients..lotsa marinara sauce with pineapple chunks and cubed, thin sliced breakfast ham.   First experience and a bit surprised, happy with the sandwich but disappointed with the soggy pizza...smh

It not often come too the Wives but have been here before for St Patricks Day is pretty nuts. I have always been a big fan of Irish Pubs and St Patricks Day become yearly tradition with hockey family. When in Irish Pub nothing better then Guinness or black and tan. I find its hit or miss comes too Guinness if not at Irish Pub. Not many people that drink it so if tap not running lot it really does affect the taste. One of the reasons enjoy my Guinness at Irish Pubs. I meet the hockey family for friends birthday party. So review not about the food. It cool small bar that great place too meet up with friends for some drinking, conversations, and good times. They do have one of those tables that can pour your own draft beers. I never ordered it so not sure the way it works. Sorry. It has lots of televisions all over for sports and one section that mini sports book on football weekends. It Notre Dame bar not that too obvious. Dah! So if fan for sure this is place you want too be. It does have none smoking (think none smoking dining section; only times come here is too drink with friends) or dining area separate from the bar area. I like the Wives and great place go drinking with friends.

Me and my boyfriend come to this bar a lot, but I just know about the food because I'm not 21 yet. We always sit in a booth in the restaurant section (which are really comfortable BTW) and it's one of my favorite spots. It's never too busy (although I've only gone at night) so I can relax and eat and I really enjoy it. The waitresses are always very friendly and accommodating and I haven't had a bad experience yet. All the food i've had there has always been delicious and filling. My mom makes better beef and cabbage, but I would expect I'd think that about any place because I am biased. Lol. For someone that isn't my mom, their beef and cabbage was surprisingly good.

My wife eat the cod sandwich, with a side of potato salad and the baked potato with mushrooms I asked her the next day what did you think of three Angry wives pub and she said AMAZING!! I had the Braveheart sandwich with au jus and a side of onion rings and side salad, the side salad and was enough for two so that was nice, the sandwich was good I felt that it needed more salt but it was good no question about it I would recommend to others and I will certainly bring eating here again!!!

Atmosphere is great and the food was good but we went in their with a buy one get one free with my mom who is on a fixed income and my son who is a tbi survivor .. needless to say we took the coupon for a reason..when we got the bull there was a 6.74 charge for using the coupon well the meal was only 8.00 do what exactly did we save? Where's the"get one free" it's a coupon scam!!

I stopped in after a long day of work just for a quick bite to eat and a cold beer. It was Weds night so I am guessing it was a slower night but I loved it! Good ALT music was playing and I got to relax here and not deal with people. The draft beer is tasty and I got the steak sandwich which was super yum.  Will be here again to try other items off the menu!
Always great food and fun.  Shannon is always helpful and the patrons are friendly. If only I can figure how how to win some money.  Definitely be back soon.

Service is absolutely HORRIBLE!!!! Waited 15 minutes before was told the bar are was open seating. Then waited another 15  minutes just to place our food order and then the waitress didn't even listen to what was ordered and had to repeat. Waitress was rude and didn't seem to care. Don't think I'll return regardless of how good the food is.

Three Angry Wives is not only a great name for an Irish Pub, but an all-around solid Irish Pub.  They have plenty of standard Irish fare plus a good selection of normal bar and grill food.  I am a fan of the chicken cobbler ciabatta.    3 Angry has a great happy hour from 2pm - 6pm  And on a personal note this is where I first fell in love with Smithwick's... completing my affinity for the Holy Trinity of Irish beer!  I have since moved on in beer tastes but there is something beautifully nostalgic about pints of Guinness, Harp and Smithwick's for me at 3 Angry.  They have several big screens if you want to watch the game....and a separate restaurant side that is considerably quieter if you want dinner without the bar feel.

I like the couch area and the pub atmosphere but I didn't appreciate the huge additional "hold" amount that the establishment added onto my debit card.  We're talking at least $30!   This hits a special nerve with me because on another occasion in a different location I used an account that was practically empty and this caused me to overdraw on that account and get charged numerous overage fees.  I think this practice is complete crap and the restaurant should warn the individual since this kind of thing can end up costing a person a pretty penny.  Luckily I had money in my account this time, but imagine my surprise to see an extra $40 tacked onto my bill when I looked at my debit account online.  When I called I was told to check back in a week and if it's still there to contact them then.  Not cool.

I've been nothing but polite to ANYONE in this establishment. So on my 6th visit in the 2 months since I've moved here, I hear while trying to eat and enjoy my drinks the manager of the Bar gossiping about a new girl who just started. I've tipped this same manager quite well in the previous visit (literally yesterday) and even tolerated an extra $43.00 charge from the pats game last Sunday, which I had to dispute with my bank from this establishment in order to get my money back, on my card. The manager in question gossiped with another co-worker about the girl in training all because she didn't want to go behind the G.M to deposit the silverware.  She literally spoke about her like a dog. I had my headphones in, they probably thought I couldn't hear, but they spoke about the new girl like an animal. I've never seen such unprofessionalism. The dirty silverware deposit wasn't exactly behind him, but it shows how rude they can be here to customers or coworkers. I was told to never come back AFTER i've spent and tipped well. Shows how you treat certain types of folks! Don't bother with this establishment! They clearly don't know customer service!  and are unwilling to accept that their customers don't want to hear employee gossip even st shift change! I could be a professional critic but I guess the GM will never know until the future.

Great food, SHIT service  For a $36 ubereats order you'd think they'd give you everything you pay for instead of what they want to give you anyway. Why give the option for ranch, then take my money for extra on the side and just not include it? Too lazy to look at the ticket? I work in the service industry and I understand that mistakes happen. But for a $30 order you can check it twice.

The happy hour deals here are really good - half off all beers and most appetizers. There were a lot of beers to choose from, draft, bottles and cans. The food was great, and we got good service. The shepherd's pie and mac and cheese bites were amazing.   I liked that the non smoking section was completely separate than the smoking section so we didn't smell any smoke.

We had a going away part here last night, and even if we weren't leaving the state, wouldn't go back. We brought a lot of business and our server refused to split our check, so we were having to go up to the bar to purchase (not cheap) drinks, where the bartender was so busy looking at his cell phone he couldn't pay attention to the fact that we were trying to order, and was rude once we actually got his attention. Service - poor. Food - ok, needless to say we ended up taking the party somewhere else.
The best Irish Pub in town, good service, GREAT food, and fun atmosphere.  Order the Wexford Wings!

Really enjoyed my time here. The staff were awesome, always on top of refills and making sure everything was ok. Plenty of beer choices, food was excellent.. The atmosphere was pretty cool, a lot of tv's, seating, and good people laughing. I would definitely come back. Check this place out!

Food was good. We had a coupon. Bill showed the coupon deducted. Because of the coupon, the tip was added. 30% is an excessive tip. Service was good - but not a 30% tip good. Left us with a feeling of being "taken" because we are seniors on a fixed income.

Came here for St. Patrick's day festivities. Green BEer was a flowing but not for me. Guinness and Bass for me and homies. For dinner I had the Corned Beef sandwich on rye with extra 1000.  The rye I am sure came from local LV bakers Great Buns and was delicious.  The Corned Beef was perfectly sliced and cooked perfect. Decent portion on the sammie.  The French fries on the side were extremely hot and fresh.  Had to ask for napkins, silverware,  beer refills,  and check.  But the sammie was awesome.

It was whatever...service was whatever...i got the classy pig which is basically a pulled pork sandwich and it was gross and disapointing. My boyfriends chicken fried steak sandwich was better then mine but he says the meat was tough. Happy hour was an okay deal, i doubt ill be back.

I wish I had a bar just like this in my hometown.   Very comfortable couches and tables to kick your feet up on. I didn't get any food, but I was pretty impressed with what was on the menu. I should have come here for dinner.   The beer selection is a little disappointing though, just your general american brews. Bud, Coors, PBR, Wyders, Blue Moon etc. The atmosphere definitely makes up for their lack of selection.  The staff was very friendly, and let you relax. We had taken over one of the couches and a few chairs, and the staff would come around and check on us at just the right times.   We liked it so much, we bought shirts and glasses so we could remember the great time we had.  I will definitely go back here on my next trip to Vegas.

From 8/14/16 Stopped into Three Angry Wives for a bite to eat before going to Targét. Located in Boca Park, Three Angry Wives, is a cool pub with a big selection of food and booze of course, because of whats a pub without alcohol.  I ordered a burger wrap, not bad. Our service was decent and quick, maybe because it was kind of slow that night. I would come back again to try some of the other foods the have on their menu
Fun pub to watch a game. Staff is super nice. It gets pretty packed during the Pat's games.

My friends and I had a horrid time at this bar.
