My female friend took the check to the bartender and told him I believe this bill has already been paid. He gave the bill to another server said this has already been paid, then he looked at my female friend and said now get the f*** out.  We immediately left.

first of all the waitress was soon rude to us when we questioned why we were charged for a SLICE of onion for our sandwich!!!!!!! the cook came out and said they had a right to make a profit!!!!!  there were four of us at 2pm  the only ones there!!!!!Lets you know how great the place is!!!!  food was... ok not great...the cook said there was cheese on our pastrami  sandwich.  not so... we couldn't see or find it!!!!we felt totally disrespected and will not go there again!!!! they r right...  .. angry people work there!!!!!!!!!

Well.........   I would have to say that the food was pretty good (breakfast), but the service was definitely lacking.  Seems like the bartender has probably be there for years and is burned out. Not friendly or welcoming at all.  She did talk to the 'regulars'.  Not sure if we would come back for breakfast.  I don't really like being locks away in the dining room, I would rather be put in the open area, but I don't want to have to tip here again :(.

This place is called three angry wives and I ran into an angry bartender, I asked where the restroom was and he said look at the signs and then proceeded to badmouth me to my girlfriend about how stupid I was for not seeing the signs, he was completely unfriendly and I just wanted to leave, I will never go back!
Service was terrible in the dining area. I can see why they add 18% tip to check. Food was horrific.

What a great place!  Thanks to a wonderful coupon while visiting Las Vegas we made our way over to this great restaurant.  There is also a pub on the other side, but the restaurant part is divided by glass and wood so there are no odors or loud noises coming from the bar.  I really love Chicken fried Chicken so I ordered that, and my husband was tired of fast food and ordered a Cobb Salad.  Both of us spent the next 45 minutes in Heaven!  The Chicken came with mashed potatoes, gravy and my choice of soup of salad.  I enjoyed a vegetable soup while waiting for my chicken, and when it arrived I was so happy to see it was just the right thickness and fried to a crispy brown.  Everything we had that night was absolutely delicious!  We were so glad we tried it because we've found a "go-to" restaurant in Vegas.  We had absolutely no complaints about anything.

Three Angry Wives is a fun little neighborhood bar/pub that has some games, decent food & plenty of TV's.  One really cool part of the bar area is a lounge section with couch style seating and darker lighting.  I didn't sit there but it seemed perfect for a couple on a date or even a group to watch a game on one of their many tv's.    As for the food I had only the Buffalo wings which i found to be tasty and meaty, nothing exemplary, but what I expected.  I ordered it with fries and it came to be just under 10 bucks which isnt outrageous either.  They have a decent selection of beer but not what I expected being an "Irish" style pub.  Service was cheerful but slow...so Im willing to overlook that.  There are better neighborhood 24 hr gaming pubs in Vegas, but 3 Angry Wives is more than fine if your close and looking for a cold one. Next time I will definitely have to go during their happy hour because they offer half priced appetizers and beer.  How did they know the way to my heart?

Was there about 6 months ago for lunch with a co-worker who goes there a lot, The food was okay but certainly nothing to write home about,   Went back there last Wednesday, working with the same co-worker and noticed a chicken fried steak sandwich on the menu, so I ordered it. It's served on grilled sourdough, with cheddar cheese, bacon, tomato, lettuce and ranch dressing. It was the bomb, the best sandwich I have had in a long time, and I eat out every work day.  So glad I gave the place a second chance, will go back often, if for no other reason than the chicken fried steak sandwich.   No smoking in restaurant, smoking in the bar.
Thought this was an Irish bar.... Loud obnoxious rap music... Very disappointed! Overpriced and rude people.

The food was tasty but the service was ridiculously bad. I cannot emphasize how poor the service was. I used to like this place. I'll never go there again.  If you enjoy being ignored this is the place for you. If you like and expect good service and are willing to pay for it, go somewhere else. BJs and Yard House have them beat a 100 times over. Don't go to 3 angry.
It's was good bar food I got a wrap ... I thought it was dumb they charged me for ranch lol but the waitress was really great cool place ... Kids can go too there's a dining area
Kicked me out for wearing a wife beater! I'm glad I don't live on this side of town, fuckin snobs

Food is so good I day dream about the menu. The pastrami sandwich is delicious and the fish and chips are tasty as well. Make sure to hit up the happy hour. Nachos are killer and the sampler is good too. I don't even want to mention the soups because it makes my mouth WATER just thinking about it. The mushroom bisque is bomb. The service is good...some nights it can take the servers awhile to come back and check on you..but when you have good drinks, food, and company the last thing you want is someone interrupting 24/7.
The food is good, and it was a nice quiet dinner with my mom

I have visited this bar on several occasions and have never had horrible service. I usually go in to eat so my review is based on the food and the service. Best places to sit for food:  1. Dining Room (when it is open) I am not sure when they close it but it's probably some time after dinner. They have booths and tables and it is usually self seating. Occasionally it is too busy so they will take names down and put you on a wait. I have never had to wait longer than 10-15 minutes.   2. Bar top I only sit here when the dining room is closed and the bar is relatively empty. (Try not to sit here, especially by video poker machines, especially when it is busy.) I feel I get the best service here when the dining room is closed, but I would never sit here and order food on a busy night, unless I am drinking and/or gambling as well. Since the bartender is readily available it is good service.  3. High top I don't usually like high tops since I feel it sometimes isn't enough space. Cocktail servers usually take care of this section. I guess on slow nights when there isn't a cocktail server the bartender will take over.   Food is always good. The best appetizers I have had are the spinach dip and the white mussels. The spinach dip is incredibly smooth and delicious, and comes with a side of garlic bread and chips. I usually skip the chips and order double bread, The mussels also come with some sort of garlic bread, which to me is salty, but ends up pairing well with the mussels. Their fries are amazing. Deliciously crispy without being burned. They charge for sides of ranch, but this isn't a dock, it's just a comment. I only know because I love ranch... especially with my fries.  The only complaint I have is that no matter where I sit I feel like I wait an unnecessary amount of time for refills.

Ugh. I've ordered food from here before on uber eats (twice last year, last time in august) and it was pretty decent. I'm not sure what changed but my dinner tonight was ridiculous. Pitiful shaved deli meat for corned beef, barely any cabbage and microwaved potatoes for 16 dollars?! The pretzel bites that used to be substantial are now a few frozen pretzel bites I could buy at Smiths for 2.99. What a waste of my money.

Went in for some lunch with some friends. We were ordering the weirdest drinks under the sun... sidecar, grasshopper, mexican coffee, mai tai.... the bartender was this nice blonde lady working in the middle of the day and she knew how to make every weird thing we ordered. not only did she know how to make all the drinks but they all tasted amazing!! she really knew her stuff and tolerated us and our odd request. Also the food was great!

One of our go-to bars in Summerlin. Three Angry Wives is an Irish bar located next to Starbucks in Boca Park. With Guiness on tap and some of the best chicken fingers Ive ever had, its impossible to not love this place.  The atmosphere is a dimmed, intimate gaming bar. The bartenders are always pleasant, and accommodating. Its exactly what you would expect a neighborhood bar to be.

Good ol' Three Angry Wives! Always reliable, rarely disappointing. The Wives has always reminded me of the Winchester in the movie Shaun of the Dead. So in the event of a zombie apocalypse, feel free to meet me at the Wives while we can have a nice cold pint and wait for everything to blow over.  This dimly lit bar/restaurant adorned with numerous TVs is a great spot to go watch a hockey or football game if you don't mind being around a little bit of cigarette smoke. Some of the cool features this bar boasts include a self-service beer tap system built into a couple of the tables, Golden Tee golf video game, separated bar/restaurant/lounge areas, and a TouchTunes music sound system. If you end up doing a little too much day drinking at the Wives, conveniently located next door is a vitamin shop where I am certain you could try to drunkenly stammer out your request for some hangover prevention goodies.  The bar food here is top-notch. I have had the Reuben sandwich served with fries and a pickle, pretzel bites with cheese and mustard, and the nachos. The Reuben was spot on in terms of quality of corned beef and sauerkraut and portion size on the bread. The pretzel bites are one of those appetizer items you order that you simply can't keep your hands off, and before you know it you are reaching for another bite only to discover you had sadly already eaten the last one! The nachos came with the standard fixin's and were rather mediocre.  The beer selection at the Wives isn't bad at all. I believe they have around 12 beers on tap, plenty of bottled beer, and of course a full bar in terms of liquor for any number of various mixed drinks. The bartenders mixing up these drinks are very attentive, fast, and friendly. I wish the same could be said for the waitresses, as this was sadly the only problem I had with the Wives.

Came here last night after work with my sister, I have got to say that I really like it! The space is big! The food is good, the drinks are even better, and the price is not bad! Would definitely come back over and over again!

Came into watch the nba finals.... Sadly it took everything to get them to turn on the volume.... More people came in to watch the game.... Then when the sound didn't come on 8 customers that were drinking and eating got up and left.... This management teams needs a significant overall.... Know of any good sports bar with sound?.... Clearly not here.... Omg this is crazy

This is no ordinary pub food. They have a separate dining room                                                              . The food is wholesome. The menu is plentiful. No greasy spoon here. They accommodated me with steamed veggies. All dishes were super delicious and reasonable.

I'm still getting used to these divey bars/joints being in strip malls. What's cool is that it does fell like a cool, divey pub/bar. However, it's next to a nail salon across the parking lot of Target. And you know it hasn't been there more than 20 years TOPS!  Ok, so that's the worst of it.  Service was GREAT! She was fun, funny w/o interfering or interjecting too much. She was on top of getting refills. The Bartender was quick and polite delivering the brews. Overall it was a great experience for sure! We are in the bar area, and we still had a great experience. Now, if you don't want to deal with smoke, I noticed that they had a glass closed off dining area adjacent to the bar and on the other side was the continuation of the dining area that wouldn't be affected by smokers. Definitely a great spot for some pub food, some beers, some sports and some just hanging out.

Slow service, service staff just kept walking by after they brought out water for our party. They didn't even come by to take our order until we had been sitting there for about 15 minutes. The waitress finally took our order and when the food came out we were happy that they didn't screw it up. All of our selections (Cajun Chicken, Meatloaf & Sliders) were delicious. (Even though they charged us extra for a side of freaking ranch) Overall, they get a C from me. Maybe I'll come back during happy hour and sit at the bar.

It understandable to feel a little apprehensive, especially if you are walking into a bar called Three Angry Wives all by your self. My first visit didn't go over so well, but it may have something to do with my fear of actually running into 3 pissed off Irish girls at once. But the place is real close by, so it was hard to stay away from.  I have made many visits to three Angry Wives since then, with each time getting better than the last. I wasn't sure I was ready to review it until last week's breakfast.  I had eaten from their menu before, but this was my first foray into the breakfast side. I ordered the hash and eggs. Mmm, mmm, good! The corned beef hash was delicious - and separated from the hash browns, so I could be allowed to choose my level of mixture.   The eggs were done perfectly and the presentation, with these little wedges of tomato and cucumber were, well, just more than I would have ever expected from a bar.  I have yet to meet anyone here who even sparked of anger, much less the women who provide the bar's namesake - and I'm just fine with that (well, maybe if they come one-at-a-time).   I will keep coming back to this little gem, especially for another morning bite-to-eat.

First time here on the weekend, service was great actually the bartenders where friendly and good prices on a good selection of beers. The bar wasn't very busy so its definitely low key so its nice to just chill and have a drink...don't know why but the hip hop playing was a little weird im just not used to that in Irish pubs but overall a cool place. I've had the food previously and they have a great fish and chips sandwich.

We love this place and have been going for several years. Even with a newborn. My daughter who is now 3, loves it here too. Service is great and the staff is super friendly. The food is also really good. We love going for breakfast with the $10 off coupon they offer. The beer selection is great. Just love it. My husband likes going himself to sit in the bar area as well.

Waitress completely forgot us and we sat several minutes and not one person took our order. This is extremely rude and insulting.   We will not return and will tell other locals of this negative experience.   Oh yeah hardly an Irish item on the menu. Gimme a break!

Stopped in for a beer while waiting for a friend.  I think the bartender was having a bad day so I'll cut him some slack.  Mid-week and not even 5pm and very smokey with only a handful of customers.  Seniors were coming in to eat the the enclosed dining room.  The few people at the bar all seemed to be regulars except me.  I might go back and see if they can make respectable fish and chips but will probably have to go into the dining area since the ventilation needs some work.

Enjoyed a few beers here while waiting for our reservation at Melting Pot next door. Place was nice, staff was friendly, beers were good. Kind of loud, but thats because it was Saturday, and football games were on. I would probably hang out at a place like this if it wasnt totally on the other side of town for me.

This place is ok but watch out for the wannabe in the fake dreadlocks. He will ruin your night. Make sure you are not winning at the machines or he will not comp your drinks. Maybe it's time for Marley to get a new job.
This place is great.  Exactly what I expect out of a pub.  Good food great prices, fast and friendly service, by people that remember you.

Love this place!  My husband won't usually go more than 2 miles from our house for food but that was before I brought him here!  Great happy hour plus awesome variety on the menu along with some of the best fries in the city!  We haven't been for breakfast so will have to try that soon!  Check the weekly paper for 2 for 1 coupons!!

came here for some late night grub with a friend. it was pretty crowded at 12am for a thursday night. we shared an order of nachos and a pulled pork sandwich. both were really good. they also serve one of my fav drinks here...black velvets (half guiness, half pear cider). this place deserves 4 stars just for those alone! i also love that its easy to walk to from my place. oh and the bartender was super cute. i'll be back. =)

This establishment is the only reason I have a nutritional intake.  The Food is so freaking good not to mention the staff are friendly, welcoming and down to earth.  The food always comes out fresh and fast cooked to perfection. Lets not forget the bartenders.  They make the most awesome drinks.  The setting is comfortable wether you want to sit at the bar and play the awesome electronic poker games, or plop down and watch the many flat screen TV's playing all the different sports.  Three Angry Wives is more then a sport bar.  Its a Irish  pub.  Lets not forget about the food.  Wether its breakfast, lunch or dinner or just eating to sober. This place is a hidden jewel of the Boca Park area of Summerlin. The folks at Three Angry Wives always make sure your food comes out hot fresh and delicious and that wouldn't happen if it wasn't for the awesome cooks working their asses off making sure everything taste superb. If you don't feel like eating in the bar or sports lounge you can sit in a quit restaurant sit down eatery.  One last thing make sure you tip you server, bartender very well. They deserve to be tipped for their serves
We went w/ a 2-fer coupon & had fish & chips. It was expensive (even with the coupon) and nothing special. The service wasn't great either. It's worth the trip cross town to go to the Crown & Anchor!

Atmosphere was pleasent. I think the server was new but she was fine. I had a Harp, a Newcastle and their Cuban. My first beer just tasted...off. I couldn't figure it out. Then I got a second beer and I felt like I was drinking Newcastle light or something. I think they water down their draft beer. Either that or the keg isn't working because it was flat and tasted off.   Their 'cuban' is more like a ham and turkey cold cut sandwich. Not a Cuban. Not pressed, meat isn't seasoned, no sauce or flavor,  they didn't even put mustard on it. Pretty sub-par. Not comin back to this place.

Came here to watch football and drink beer and eat.  Sat at the bar, Service was great and Erin the bar tender was awesome until we asked to put on the Alamo bowl game on the speakers, Said he didn't want to hear it. Guess he would rather listen to 80s music instead. Don't come here if you want to hear any of the games. Otherwise food was great. Needless to say but I left to Goto another bar that I could listen to the Alamo bowl and watch it.

Just don't bother. Went here on a Friday. Place was busy, but isn't every place?  Got seated at 5:40, server took our order at 6:03 and we got our food at 6:25. She never came back to ask if we wanted more beer, never came back to ask how our food was. I had to flag her down to get our check because we had to be out of there at 6:30 to meet some other friends.  Funny how people who got there way later than us came and went. Food was good, but a lot of places have good food and great service.

We walked in two angry wives and left two happy wives.  My girl Jesse is moving away so we have been making the rounds.  Came in late on a weekday and was greeted by a nice bartender.  I don't know how the conversation started but I was feeling nostalgic and asked him if he could make a watermelon shot.  He whipped one up and down the hatch it went and I was feeling like I was back in college on bar row. The best thing?  Courtesy shot!  That's right , it was on the house!    I told my husband later that stuff like this always happens when I'm out with the girls.  Free drinks, free cover, free appetizers.  Las Vegas treats ladies like royalty!  BTW:  Love celeb gossip and learned Nicolas Cage was here a few weeks ago!  So lots of extra stars just for the coolness factor.

While this place has a sectioned off area for the smoking, bar space, and a restaurant area, unlike many of the places in Vegas they do not give you two bills at the end of the night (one for food and one for drinks), which I'm a fan of.  The food is standard bar food, though they do have wrap versions of various burgers. You would think these would be better for you, but they are just as greasy and fattening as a regular burger, only without the bread bun to absorb the grease.  The crowd is always a mix of 21's to 40's and the staff is always nice and helpful with getting you intoxicated.

The food was pretty good, but the service was AWFUL. We weren't even addressed when we walked in, until someone finally (as in 5 minutes later) acknowledged our existence and told us to seat ourselves. We did, and then about ten minutes later the waitress finally came up and very rudely told us that we were supposed to wait to be seated. We explained the situation, to which she just replied "Oh." And walked off and didn't come back to check on us for about another ten minutes. Not only that, but the service was ridiculously slow for the rest of the night. She only came back and checked on us like once. Had a terrible attitude the entire time. Will probably never be coming back.

This place sucks.  If you're gaming they don't comp drinks.  My fiancé put in $100 on her machine and I put in $40.  We both played a lot but neither of us lost money.  The food was so-so but when the bill came they charged us for 2 two beers we ordered even though we were consistently gaming.  That pissed me off, every other place around town comps your beverages if you're playing.  I would not go back nor would I recommend this place to anyone else.  The prices are high for ok quality and they are obviously cheapskates.

Have been coming to Three Angry for a few years now .. and up until recently had only visited in the late night / early morning hours after work. Boy have I been missing out!!!   I didn't realize in my post work, wine-drinking stupor that they have what is probably the best breakfast menus around. First off .. I have to say that I have a HUGE sweet tooth & LOVE french toast! Three Angry Wives offers not one, not two, but FIVE different versions of french toast! My fave is the Reeses French Toast which combines Peanut Butter Captain Crunch, peanut butter, and hot fudge. The toast is nice and thick and the portions are huge! Some other notable items are the Pretzel Bites with Cheese sauce .. so yummy! And the Cajun Chicken which has just the right amount of spice.  Service was great, and the ambiance relaxed and comfortable. There are signs around the bar-top to let guests know that the seats in front of the video poker machines are reserved for gamblers, which, if you like to play .. you'll appreciate :)

This place is average at best.  The ambience is good for watching games and as a social Hang.  Their prices are too expensive for anything I ordered.  Below average food, under poured drinks.  When your a vegas local in hospitality you don't wan to feel like your getting ripped off for drinks and cheap food.

Excellent little pub off the strip, which means you can get 2 pints, 2 full meals, an appetizer, and tip (as opposed to a couple watered down drinks) for $40.    An excellent stop on your way back from Red Rock Canyon, which is highly recommended and an easy drive from the center of downtown Vegas.

My husband and I are making the rounds through the Irish Pubs here in Las Vegas and we finally got to this spot about 3 weeks ago.  I had seen the sign and loved the name for a long time but we live on the other side of town so it took awhile to actually eat here. It was not, at all, worth the wait and the drive.  We went on a Friday night, got there around 7 p.m..  It was obviously busy, like you'd expect on a Friday night, but it wasn't anything outrageous.  We stood at the Hostess podium for a good 10 minutes without even being acknowledged.  Employees (servers and the woman who eventually seated us) were going all around us, doing things, not one bothered to make eye contact and say they would be right with us.  I've worked as a hostess and I find that really annoying - it only takes a second.  Finally after about 10 minutes, a guy says there's no open tables and there will be a short wait.  That's fine - except there isn't really anywhere to wait that's out of the way.  The bar section was full.  So we had to kind of stand in the doorway and move every time someone wanted/needed to get thru.  The layout of the place is weird.  Also, it was really warm inside. Anyway, after about another 15 minutes or so (felt like forever), we were finally seated.  The menu is very blah - didn't have the traditional Irish Pub charm we were looking for.  The music was super loud and plain old American radio crap (no Irish music!).  It absolutely stunk of cigars.   I don't remember exactly what we ordered but pretty sure I had a burger.  All 3 (friend joined us) of us were unimpressed.  The food was just bland and boring.  Again, it was typical American diner/restaurant food, which isn't what we were hoping for going to an Irish Pub.  And it wasn't even good!  We definitely left food behind on our plates and didn't bother to bring home any left overs. So after all that waiting, the food was crappy.  The service was fine, unremarkable enough that I can't remember even whether we had a man or a woman.  Overall, we definitely won't be coming back any time soon and I won't recommend it to any friends.  There are plenty of other Irish Pubs here that are far better!

My hubby and I love the Three Angry Wives and frequently stop in for a little pub atmosphere with delish eats and MANY icy cold draft beer choices at reasonable prices!  Even better during Happy Hour!  Breakfast is always great too!  We've never been disappointed with anything on their menu.  The staff is usually pretty friendly, not always quick, but hey - if you holler, they'll be right over!!  Their breakfast burrito is one of the best ever and is huge, so we usually end up sharing it . . . we also love the crispy shrimp wrap, baja chicken wrap, philly chese steak and their potato skins are great too!  My 8 year old daughter loves the sliders and actually asks for them from time to time! :)    We don't usually partake in gaming there, but the few times that we have, we've had no problems with our comps -- we've always been comped while playing.    Nice neighborhood gem -- we love places like this and always try to support the community.  It's not a 5-star only because like I mentioned service can be slow and because you often leave smelling of smoke (but they do have a smoke-free) area too. This one is one of our faves!
Nice and dark inside as a proper pub should be. Good food, you can smoke, friendly staff, jovial regulars, what more could you want?

This is just OK. Everything about it is just OK. Food, gaming, people, etc. Same guys are always there at night, not overly friendly, just doing their jobs. I hate when you order sliders and it is 3 separate little buns but one regular hamburger patty cut into 3 sections, after being cooked. Doesn't resteraunts understand a slider is supposed to have the crisp browning all the way around?

Worst service in the world!  20 minutes at table and still no waitress/waiter! Can't decide which is more sticky - the  table or the menu. Came here for the yelp reviews of food and should of listened to the reviews on service. The reason the service is so bad is because they add 18% tip to all orders regardless of size. Why give good service when tip is automatic?!?  #HorribleManagementDecision.

Bartender wouldn't comp my drinks. When I asked why he said I only played $20 (when I was actually playing for over an hour and lost $60 and lost quite a bit more earlier in the week). Been living in Vegas off and on for about a decade and never experienced such bad service. Hey bartender go check my players card (played last machine - around 3am August 1st ). I've played a lot recently because you are a block from my house, but that is the last time I go there again.

Have a really great time - I've been here before and really enjoyed myself then as well. I totally approved of the staff again, and was more than pleased with the food selections. We had nachos which is a favorite- rectangle chips- so that's cool- she ordered potato skins- he liked the nachos and neither of us finished either plate. Tons of tvs to stare at if you're bored :) perfect music volume for a great conversation. I hope infer to go again soon!

I have been a customer of 3 Angry Wives for the past couple of years. I have introduced my family and friends to the pub and have never had a problem at the Charleston location until of course today. I was at the pub on Friday specifically to ask if one of the football games on Sunday you would be airing was the Raider/Miami game. I was told by both the bar back and server that yes, if I brought my group of people in, we would be able to watch this game. We arrive this morning early and asked that one of the TV's at the bar could be turned to the game and were told that no  - you were only airing four specific games, the Raiders not being one of the four. Then to insult us more, it wasn't good enough that we are paying customers who would be there for well over four hours eating and drinking, we were told that since no one asked the female bartender's permission to watch our game, she could put it on one screen but if someone came in and wanted to play the machine and watch a different game, she would just take it off.   How dare she! REALLY??? Our money isn't good enough to view something we had already been told two days prior that we could watch????   At any rate, I am never coming back to spend money at your pub - nor will my friends or family. You need to have your bartenders get schooled in customer service. I am disgusted by the way we were treated.   We actually found a much more friendly place to watch our game and will continue to spend our money with them as they actually care about their customers.

If I could give this place zero stars I would do not eat here probably the most horrible customer service I have ever experienced I ordered through uber eats they messed my whole order up literally forgot my chilli gave me a burger I didn't even order so I called the bar cause that's all that was open at this time the man who answered the phone was extremely rude to me told me to call uber eats and deal with it through them he said he didn't have time to sit here and talk on the phone I didn't get his name but I'm guessing he was the bartender I hope nobody eats here you don't deserve to be open treating customers like this

Last Sunday my husband and I went to Three Angry Wives Irish Pub in Summerlin specifically to get a sandwich that was recommended to us. This was the Chicken Cobbler Ciabatta ($9.99)- breaded chicken breast topped with cobbler baked apple slices, dried cranberries, cheddar cheese, lettuce, and honey Dijon sauce - sounds intriguing, doesn't it? I am a fan of the Bobbie sandwich at Capriotti's, which is basically Thanksgiving on a hoagie, so I was looking forward to trying a similar version here. Well, this was the perfect example of how sometimes something can sound good in theory but in reality, or in the hands of the wrong person, becomes a failure. In this case the sandwich was not totally without merit, but left plenty of room for improvement nonetheless. It seems appropriate to make a compliment sandwich for the Chicken Cobbler by pointing out something positive, followed by its problems, and finishing on another high note.  Dear Sandwich, The ciabatta bread you were served on was fresh and performed it's job well. Unfortunately, you were too sweet and one dimensional. Your apples weren't necessarily a bad choice but the 'cobbler' didn't work for me. Additionally, I would like to see you served with crispy chicken that wasn't fried thirty minutes ago when I placed my order but not delivered until now. I hold this more against the slow kitchen and servers than you, so don't feel too bad. At least your chicken was still juicy. Finally, I'd like to commend you on your choice of plate partner - I very much enjoyed the fries! Sincerely, Frugal Foodie  In addition to the sandwich, we had a bowl of chicken and dumpling soup ($5.99), which was flavorful but a little too thick. I won't quite compare it to gravy but it was moving in that direction. Ian also had a Bloody Mary that was one of the better he's had in town. The award for top Bloody Mary goes to Hash House, and is the only reason to ever step foot in that restaurant (Hash House exemplifies everything that is wrong with dining in America by encouraging people to eat enough food for a week in one sitting).  As I mentioned in my letter to Sandwich, the kitchen was ridiculously slow and the servers were sweet but not entirely competent. It took ten minutes to order our food and another thirty five to get it out, and this was on a Sunday morning in a Pub. I'd be weary of going back during peak times. My soup wasn't hot when it came out and we overheard the kitchen staff gripe, so I wasn't left with the best taste in my mouth (or maybe that was their spit?). Overall, we walked out of Three Angry Wives as Two Semi-Angry Customers, and will not likely be returning for the mediocre pub food.

Decided to try this place out since Uber eats was picking up from there. They estimated the food to get to us 30 minutes. The food was being prepared for atleast 45 minutes. We live down the road so my driver was able to get to us in 10 mins, she was great. Onions rings were good with the cajun mayo, however for $7 they were small and didn't give enough. I ordered the "Braveheart Sandwhich" for $11. If it wasn't soggy, it would've been good.  While digging through my fries, i found a piece of hair underneath the liner of my container. Gross. My fiance got the "Get Some Burger" for $11.The burger was supposed to have jalapeños, cheese sauce and shoestring onions. All that came with it was the cheese sauce. It tasted just like a regular burger. Overall, probably wouldn't try it again especially since there was a hair on my plate.

This is a horrible place to have fun. 2 and a half weeks ago. I went in to play a couple of twenty a on video poker. When I put a twenty in , I ordered a beer, 140 quarters later, I ordered another. The bartender (if that's you want to call him) told me I would have to play every quarter, win or lose. Then put another 20 in before I could have another beer. I still had 55 quarters left at that time, so I checked my e-mails then played it down to 40 quarters. The bartender then told me not only that he could not compt me for the first beer, and that I would have to pay for the second. Even though I declined it, due to the fact that he opened it after informing me about their non VEGAS policy. I had no choice other than to pay for 2 beers or play the remaining 10 dollars on dollar play(5 times 1). Original Vegas locals , stay away from this b

GREAT HAPPY HOUR 2-6pm Monday-Friday. Half price beers and appetizers. *Another reviewer stated that they had a bad beer selection of ONLY American beers.  This is not true.  They have Bass, Harp, Guiness, and Stella ON TAP.*  They have a smoke-free restaurant with comfortable booths and a large bar where you can smoke.  The food is good.  Excellent french fries and battered fish.  The local newspaper usually has a 2 for 1 coupon, so 2 people can eat and drink for under $20.  I wish I could give this place 5 stars for the value.  The food is 4 stars.

Migle was a conscientious and fabulous server. Very upbeat and positive. Knew the menu inside and out.  She gave wonderful recommendations. Glasses were chilled and the beer ice cold. It's nice when people pay attention to details!  Very refreshing in a day and age where deplorable service is ubiquitous.

Just ate there for the first time ever. I wasn't impressed with their breakfast at all. Their Huevos Rancheros SUCK! That was the most awful excuse for huevos rancheros I have ever seen!! I could not eat it, it was gross! Sorry guys, but you need to remove that item from the menu!
Solid pub food on a menu with a few nice surprises. Not overpriced, about what I'd expect from such a venue. Service was solid, drinks refilled, orders correct. Will be back for sure.

My husband and I have been here a few times. We stop by for a couple of beers and once we ordered food. They have a huge menu and their food is also good. It's near our house and it's an easy bar to relax at.

Food was very decent. Very good tasting burgers! Prices are O.K. but when I went we had a deal of a coupon for buy1 get1 entrees. I enjoyed the dim lite atmosphere. You can certainly relax, enjoy a cold beer, watch a game and enjoy some tasty food.  The bar is divided into two parts, a dinning area and the bar/dinning of course. The dinning area is small and not as cozy. I'd prefer for larger tables in the bar/dinning area because your plates can barely fit.   The only bad thing I could say is that the table was kinda sticky, not very clean but heck! I really enjoyed my Shamrock Burger :)

If you find yourself getting a flavor of the "real las vegas", check out the increasingly trendy Summerlin area just north of the strip and closer to the actual Red Rock Mountains.  Three Angry Wives is one of my staple stops during my twice a year visits to Sin City, aka Las Vegas. Located well off the famous strip and away from the downtown crush of tourists, this Irish themed bar-pub- casino reminds me of typical pubs you would find in any modest sized city across America.    Classic pub grub is surrounded by some unique takes on Irish classic dishes.  3AW releases a steady stream of coupons and discounts that make going here with a friend an ideal and affordable choice.  If you want a good meal, don't want to cook and kinda feel like staying in your sweat pants... This spot is calling you. Your wallet will also smile.

This is a neighborhood place geared toward locals in Boca Park Shopping Center. Like all these neighborhood places the bar is closed off from the restaurant which is a relief for non-smokers.    Hubby and I tried this place around 4 p.m. on a weekday and the food was pretty good. We had a couple of sandwiches and fries and two iced teas. Nobody serves water here unless you ask for it. Our bill came to about $25.   We'll probably be back. I prefer if over Bilbo's down the street.

my wife ordered a spinach salad through uber, we get the food and her salad is fuckin small, it is not worth the price and it is a rip off, i ordered better salad from a diffrent place with more portion for the same price, this place is a rip off, theh gave my wife, literally a baby hand scoop of salad with chopped boiled eggs. and baby crumbles of bacon bits and blue cheese, seeiously, i want my dam money back this is a waste of money and now we are going out tonight.this was fuckin billshit!!!!

Amazingly delicious food.  The burger I ordered as med rare was cooked perfectly, unusual in today's cook it well society.  All four in our group loved the food we ordered and the waitress was fantastic.  Friendly service without being pushy at all.  Love it and will return again. Be sure to try to Mac and Cheese appetizers they are to die for.

Awful service! Read the reviews but decided to try it anyways.. Walked in, waited close to 5 minutes for anyone to say a word to us though it was NOT busy. Finally got seated, waitress clearly hates her job.. We ask for a beer list and she says "it's right in front of you" then we ask about beer prices which are not listed on the menu.. She says "i don't know, I couldn't tell you" LOL what a joke! We walked out, never to return

We've gotten takeout from here a couple times and I have figured out why the 3 wives are angry.. Because pretty much everyone who works here is angry or in a bad mood ... sheeeesh! The food alone is not that bad though.. about 3 star worthy.  We have tried: *Grilled Hot & Chopped Greek Salad: $11.99 I love Greek salad so I enjoyed this dish.. it's topped with grilled Gyro meat and warm pita bread.. *Buffalo Chicken Sliders: $9.99 Comes with 5 sliders.. nothing impressive.. prepare to get messy.. We paid an extra $1.99 for onion rings but they gave us fries.. *BBQ Chicken Grilled Pita Pizza: $11 the pizza is 6" so it's not that big but it comes with soup or salad.. I guess this is one of their "healthier" choices haha   HOT TIP: if you want to avoid the super smoky bar air use the back entrance ...it's smoke-free~

First time here - ordered the Shepard's Pie.  Now I know that this isn't an authentic Irish Pub and I wasn't expecting that but come on guys - at least make an effort!  My Shepard's Pie consisted of a bland mixture of ordinary ground beef (no seasoning I could detect) mixed with green beans for some ungodly reason covered by a layer of bland potatoes covered by a layer of melted cheese that very well could have been Kraft singles.  It wasn't baked slightly roasty like you'd expect in an actual Shepard's Pie but rather could very well have been microwaved.  It was all less than mediocre.  Additionally the manager/bartender there, Reggie, is visibly stressed and provided less than polite service.  Possibly an OK place to get a Harp or a Guiness (though there are far better) but don't eat there.

After reviewing previous reviews I had to think twice about trying Three Angry Wives because of the service issues.  We had a wonderful experience.. service as well a quality of food.  Do not let the reviews sway you from trying this establishment.  I had the fish and chips, caesars salad (loved it), Husband had the bangers mash (just OK). All sandwitchs look wonderful coming out of the kitchen, I will definitely be back soon.

We're in the area and it's time for dinner.  Heading into the closed off section for diners, we sat in a booth.  We chose to order from the dinner entree section of the menu, which is only available from 4 pm to 11 pm.  All entrees are served with soup or salad, vegetables, garlic bread; and a choice of a baked potato, mashed potatoes or fries.  * BBQ Pork Ribs "Slow cooked with our own sweet savory sauce." ($18) - The Husband ate up all his pork ribs, along with the sides.    * New York Steak "14 oz. steak, lightly seasoned, broiled to your liking, topped with mushrooms sauteed in fresh garlic and herbs." ($19) - I finished up my steak and mushrooms, along with my string beans and baked potato.  There was nothing special about our meal, it was standard food although a bit expensive.  Service was fine, they had a steady stream of customers coming in to dine as well.  Apparently, they do have a happy hour so it's better to call ahead to check what times they happen.

I was so excited to try this place. I liked the music & the atmosphere but it was too dark to read the menu (the couple that came in as we were leaving had an offer to turn a light on.) There was no official server, which I understand can't be helped if someone calls out, but I was really disappointed with our experience. I ordered a veggie potato add cheese & it was accidentally put into the computer with an "add ham." I told the guy that took our order & picked the ham off & ate it...not a big problem. Except that nothing was done to make it right & he just seemed really annoyed with us. When we got the bill I was charged for the added ham. I asked him about removing it & he told me he did me favor bc the charge for cheese cost more than ham. He said he "could read body language" & didn't like that my husband (a restaurant manager) seemed upset. He then offered to make me another potato?? Bc that's what I wanted after we finished our meal. Um...if you make a mistake & admit it was your fault & you inconvenienced a customer you at least try to make it right without a poor attitude. Needless too say I left with nothing but a paid 50$ tab & a frown.

Bartenders were amazingly slow and unfriendly, never came by unless waved down. Bar currently has 7 people and there are 3 people behind the bar and they couldn't look more serious. No personalities. Will never be back.
When you're in the mood for a good beer in a dark bar with yummy comfort food this is the spot. My only wish is that I could enter the non-smoking section without walking through the smoking section.

I thought this place was a good choice to try out and I was right.  My boyfriend and I sat at a little bar table and had a good view of a baseball game.  I wanted to try one of their specialty dishes and asked our server about the Meat Loaf and she sold me on that item.  My boyfriend choose the beef stroganoff dish with egg noodles.  Both dishes were very flavorful and very large in portions.  By the time we left, we were so full!  The service and food was great!  We will be back!

Hoping to get an authentic Irish pub experience with Irish beer and friendly people? Don't come here. No Kilkenny or Smithwicks. Nothing on the food menu is remotely non-American. Unless you count Shepard's Pie, which is actually English so you shouldn't count it. In a pretty much empty bar, I got asked to move by the bartender so some old guy could gamble at the machine I was sitting at. Go gamble at one of the other eight empty machines, Old Yellow Hands!  It's pretty much just a PT's that never take their St. Patrick's Day decorations down.
We were here on a Saturday afternoon and had lunch.  The food was good and the service was awesome. Shannon at the bar is the best!

I like this restaurant.  They always have coupons.  Food is good, service excellent. I have never had anything I did not like.  A las Vegas bargain. My favorite thing I almost always order is a Patty Melt.  They have a very good menu. Lot of good stuff. Dining room is enclosed, so no smoking there.  there is another room that has the bar,, Tv's etc.

First time here. Others picked the restaurant for lunch. Service was fine, it was the food that was terrible. I had the Ruben that had absolutely no flavor. Someone else had the fish & chips. They said it had a very fishy taste. They didn't finish it.  I can't speak for the others but I'd never go back. Very disappointing. The parking lot is difficult to get into as it's enteabce is next to Starbucks drive-thru.

Okay, so bottomless salads can only go so far before the smoke and hit-or-miss service starts to wear on you. We have returned on several occasions, and sometimes the experience is great. Other times, it is a bit lackluster and reeks of cigar smoke. For optimal eating enjoyment, I recommend sitting in the smoke-free side room or directly at the bar. The middle area receives less than stellar service and the majority of the smoke. Also, if you're a Notre Dame fan, this is definitely a spot for brethren. If you're not, you will want to avoid when the Fighting Irish have a game, as the game definitely takes precedence over anything else that may be happening, including you trying to enjoy dinner. Still, I do think they do bar food well, and they definitely serve an ice cold beer. I appreciate both!

Visited this place for the first time after a few people had raved about some of the things on the menu.  If you like a cool looking Irish pub, it definitely has that appeal inside.  The downside was I felt a little bit cramped.  I ordered one of the chicken sandwiches and it was cooked just alright.  Five hard pieces of iceberg lettuce was a little bit of a turn off, but it was alright.  I felt that the machines were a little stiff but only played a few hundred.  It was packed for the Michigan Ohio state game.  If you are looking for a place to watch football, this is a pretty cool place in the area, however the food was just average.  I'm told the buffalo chicken dip is good so I will try that next time!

Went here for drinks and dinner. My friend and I were originally going to hit up Applebee's for burgers but the curbside appeal of this place drew us in. At first glance the crowd is a bit older and mellow for a Friday night. The staff was friendly and not overbearing. We started off with a couple drinks that were nicely poured ;-) I don't consider myself a light weight but 3/4 into my long beach tea I was feeling it! I ordered the southern comfort, which is a heaping pile of deliciously smooth and fluffy mashed potatoes swimming in chicken noodle soup. It was so good! Definitely a comfort food. OH and did I mention the garlic toast!? After my stomach settled and I downed my second Long beach tea I was ready for mashed potato heaven round two.   We sat away from the bar in the dinning section and they let us hang out at our booth well after they closed the section down. The music was good and I'm sure geared more towards the staff than patrons but that worked perfect for us 20 something girls. Everything was very clean, food looked and tasted great, and drinks were reasonable. I  will definitely be back. Only reason I rated it 4/5 is because I didn't get a chance to experience the bar atmosphere. However, that was my fault for sitting in the other section.

Three Angy Wives pub won me over with it's decadent french toast that's more dessert than breakfast. Located in the Boca Park shopping center, Three Angry Wives doesn't immediately come to mind as a breakfast choice, but I had a coupon for a buy one get one free entree in my local Entertainment coupon book handy. My husband and I opted to sit in the quiet smoke-free dining section of the restaurant for this visit.  REESE'S FRENCH TOAST ($9.99): Battered in Captain Crunch peanut butter cereal and topped off with melted peanut butter and hot fudge. Tasted as good as it sounds. I was in fat girl heaven. And yup, I slathered on Ms. Butterworth's syrup to top it all off. Talk about a high-calorie meal! Came with 3 pieces of french toast, but I only finished half. I'll ask for the half-order next time. 4.5/5     MAYDAY MUFFIN ($9.99): Sausage, egg, and cheese inside two english muffins with a side of hashbrowns. Husband approved of the breakfast but hashbrowns could've used more flavor. 4/5  SERVICE: Waitress was quiet but efficient. An 18% auto-gratuity is tacked on when using the Entertainment coupon.   VIBE: A good old-fashioned Irish pub.  Worth a Return Visit? Breakfast is better than lunch here! Trust me, I know from experience (said in Chris Farley's voice from Billy Madison). The Reese's french toast is calling my name.  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #233

If you want bad service make sure you ask for Taylor L. We requested to have our bills split due to being a large party. She refused and stormed off from our table and had the nerve to refuse service to us. The worst part was, was that we weren't able to address it. There was no manager, and the response we got from another staff member was that she was having a bad day! Really....Can I act that way at work? No! They then sent a bus boy to serve us, which not to mentioned, turned our entire service around. He did a great job, Thank you! Anyway, when our food came out, she placed our food on a booth a few feet away and wouldn't even deliver the food to our table. After our meal we asked to have the contact number to someone we can reach out to as we thought her behavior was not acceptable she still had the nerve to laugh it off. I never had anything like this, but if you go there make sure she isn't serving you! Other then this, the food was great!

My first experience was a Ribeye steak and no complaints, service was ok and I said, I'll come back here again.  However, months later when we visited again...downhill it went...no hostess, so you seat yourself and the waiter came about 15min later...this should've been a sign, however we waited, and waited.  They kept walking pass us until another patron offered us his menu.  We were rather hungry and didn't want to leave to find another place to have dinner, since we had a BOGO Free coupon.  I should've left, is all I know.  It appears they prepare food that is already processed, the plate was not hot...just overall bad business.  It's basically a sports bar, and I'll never visit again.

If you are looking for a place where everybody knows your name, and they are always glad you came...then The Wives should be your first stop! The food is incredible, the service gets 5 stars, and I never saw so many people hit jackpots! Check out this place for a good time and local-loving.

I enjoyed the happy hour beer pricing. I'm not a huge beer fan but the Angry Orchard beer tasted like a hearty apple cider, it was crisp and refreshing without being the least bit bitter. The mushroom sliders weren't part of the happy hour pricing but they were worth every penny. They were served piping hot with the sauteed mushrooms and onions melding perfectly with the cheese and sweet bun. The burger patty was seasoned perfectly for my taste. The Nachos were HUGE. They were quite tasty as well with so many toppings including chili, and marinated jalapenos. We ordered the white steamed mussels (also not on the happy hour menu) and the portion was also generous with several pieces of garlic bread to sop up the delectable broth. The onion rings were okay, nothing special but the cajun mayo sauce that accompanied it was a surprise treat. Service was excellent, however as it got busier in the bar, the drinks started coming out slower. I was also annoyed that a whole family complete with small kids came in and sat close by with a screaming kid. I realize it's not the fault of the restaurant but it still soured the experience for me a bit.   I like the friendly staff and that Angry Orchard beer, besides happy hour for 3 people came to just under $40 with all that food plus drinks!

As for Irish pubs go, I prefer going to other places but my roommate at the time swore by this place so I went.  Food is actually decent so that was a gift in itself.  It's hard to find decent bar food and when you get out of work as late as I do, you want something tasty.  The bartenders, it depends on who is on at the time.  Some are personable but most just aren't and when i go to a place like this I expect the staff to be more jovial.  It's a pub.  It seemed too stuffy for me.  Prices are ok.  I only come here to see my old roomie so for the most part I have a beer and then I just bounce.

We used to love this place. The food is very good. What ticked us off the last time we went was the bartender. He was jamming out to rap music and kept turning it up. I could not hear my husband. I was under the impression their was a jukebox? A pub is a place you go to have a pint and some chips (vinegar and salt...yummy) watch some football and have a good time. This is the second time this has happened and we won't be going back. My husband is from the UK and we want a place where we can get that feel. This is not a true Irish pub, so for the people who say it is...you have never been to an actual pub in the UK. I also stunk of smoke and did not finish my drink. From pub to club. Boo!
We just stopped in for a drink. It's a great Irish Pub, we did not try any food.  But for drinking it's great!

Bartenders are not personable, and I've been here multiple times. Save your money for a fun bar and leave these douchebags alone. Maybe then they will be more appreciative of new business  Also, i have heard nothing but rotten things about their st pattys day festival of overpriced admission and drinks.

So, I we go to this bar generally 3-4 times a year and normally it was an all around good time. Went Monday December 10th and !*NOT A GOOD! TIME. The Bar tender wearing a Patriots jersey would not even say HI to us after we sat down. We had to ask for  food menus, he threw one of the table.(there was 2 of us) Then we had to ask, after waiting 20 minutes if its ok if we ordered some food? He said sure, (felt like it was a problem that we were ordering food?) Then after getting our two plates $19 a piece, we had to ask for some silverware. Food was good as always, but his (both bar tenders actually) customer service was terrible. MY GIRLFRIEND AND I DID NOT FEEL WELCOMED AT THIS BAR. WE WON"T BE RETURNING AT ALL NEXT YEAR. NOT WORTH THE DRIVE ACROSS TOWN ANYMORE=(

This has been my go-to spot for years.  The service is fantastic, the prices good, and the food is amazing.  I have yet to find better wings anywhere in Vegas.  I try to stop in at least once a week for wings and a cold beer.

Nice place. They serve what you  might call "pub food"- wings, grilled cheese, fries, salads, etc. at reasonable prices.  I've gone there mainly to make use of their wireless internet connection while enjoying lunch or dinner.  The staff leave you alone and don't rush you at all. The food is fine- nothing special. The service is good and the waitstaff have always been super friendly.

This is our #1 spot for a late night breakfast.  A HUGE (very splittable) plate, of awesome breakfast food is around 7 dollars.  Everything on their menu is delicious, and they have an awesome selection.     They have a smoke-free dining area sectioned off from the bar, with large booths, and a few tables.  You can also eat at the bar, or in their little lounge area.  They have some suuuuper cozy, squishy, leather couches there.  The only thing I dislike about 3AW is that it's a sports bar. Everything on their tvs must be sports at all times.  Sometimes they have the hunting channel on (EW!), but the bartender has never refused to change it for me.

For a pub this place is simple, decor is cool, lots of Tv's and music. They have a lounge area for comfy seating and tables.  Food was ok. Pretzel bits app was good because it came with really good cheese dip.  You can never go wrong with draft beer.    Most of all the bartender was very nice and attentive.  Just disappointed there wasn't a big Irish menu.

Cold crisp draft beer!!!! There were 2 Bartenders working that were very friendly and polite... One recommended a Chicken sandwich with Cranberries that was awesome, steak sandwich was ok but not recommended by the staff...  The bar was very laid back inside people kept to themselves more of a real locals hangout.  Clean bathroom with plenty of soap and paper towels :)  For a bar that allows smoking it didn't smell like a astray inside great ventilation... The meals were under $10.00 very inexpensive & the beer was cheap in cost also..
This place is just a cool pub to hangout. Its a good place to get out, grab a couch, some beer and wings and catch the game!  Definately two thumbs up!!

I would have given 4 stars since the food was great,  but service is a real problem here. The Yelpers were right!  First, we waited for 15 minutes to be seated.  Then,  once we sat down and ordered drinks, we waited again.  Our waitress finally showed up to take our food order. Guess what? We waiting probably another 15 minutes just to get our salads. Not cool.   We finally got oir food,  which was delicious- shepherds pie and lemon herb chicken.  After we got our order, our waitress seemed to disappear.  Busboys were checking on us, refilling drinks, getting leftover boxes, AND getting oir check. Our waitress didn't deserve the tip they automatically add to the check. I disagree with that because her tip would have been much less than they add. Unacceptable. It's too bad because the food was great.  Service needs some serious improvement!

Best Pub in Las Vegas.   Awesome food, great specials, fun crowd.  This place is packed during Patriots games, and has an amazingly lively crowd, they make every game fun. Food is terrific, great wings, awesome fish & chips, and wonderful Shepherd's Pie!
The music machine is not playing. I ordered food they were throwing out and asked to pay extra for an an extra serving,  they chose to throw it out then give a customer the left overs. WOW!!!

They have a nice selection of beers available. I had a Summer Shanty which was a bit too lemony for my taste buds ($5) and a loaded baked potato ($7.99) which is very nice with lots of bacon....mmm bacon......bacon.....bacon.  I actually like their chicken fried steak here too.   It's a dark Irish bar, with lots of gaming seats, and also some couch and table sitting with several TV's. A few games like Golden Tee. There's also a dining area thats sectioned off from the smoking bar. A nice place to meet friends, grab a bite to eat with decent and fairly priced food and a huge selection of items.

I went here for the first time for a former coworker's going away gathering. The service was quick. However, I was not impressed with the drinks or food. I had a side order of fries with cheese; the fries were dry tasting. When I ordered my first drink, I asked for vodka with a splash of cranberry juice. It came out fine. The second time around, a different server refilled my drink. When I raised my hand to get her attention for my refill, she knew that I previously had vodka and cranberry; she walked away to fill my order so quickly, that I didn't get the chance to tell her "a splash of cranberry juice." My second drink came out tasting and looking like a glass of cranberry juice. I went for something different with my third drink - a lemon drop shot. It tasted watered down, which is odd since it had no ice in it.   I asked about happy hour specials prior to ordering and was told the appetizers were half off before 6:00 p.m. When my bill came, I had a 50% discount for the base price of the $6 side order of fries and was charged $1 extra for the cheese. My two vodka and cranberry drinks were $5.50 each. My lemon drop was $6.50. Overall, the food and drinks were not worth the $23.45 that I paid (not including the tip).

This place's food was good but the waitress was horrible, she seemed like she was occupied with other things and took forever to take our order, then they used the excuse "oh we are swamped" When we entered the place they were not busy at all. Now that is bull, she was unable to handle having our table. This place was recommended by several people as well, might go back to try the food, there were more dishes I wanted to try, but will ask for a different server next time!

Had dinner here and ordered the Corned Beef and Cabbage at the bar. Most of the bar space was occupied by built-in slot machines giving little room for eating. Bartender acknowledged me as soon as I sat down and took my order down as soon as I was ready. Wait time for my order was minimum. The salad prior to my entree was fresh and of good size. My entree was huge in portion but disappointing because they used corned beef slices that were thin and used for sandwiches instead of the thick sliced corned beef that I was used too when ordering such an entree. I wouldn't recommend the entree to a true Irishman if needed be. Ordered a drink for desert and that was it. Nothing really stand out for me in this establishment that would make me want to come back again on my own.

I went here, Diane and friends in tow, for my St. Patrick's Day Corned Beef & Cabbage fix two days before St. Patrick's Day to avoid the teeming crowds that always occur on that festive day.  After enjoying very good cheesy Tater Skins that were topped with cheese, bacon pieces, and chives; a fine cup of Tomato Florentine Soup; and a Dinner Salad with good Honey Mustard Dressing that was Dijon-like, the eagerly awaited desired entree was set before me.  As hoped for, it featured excellent lean Corned Beef and perfectly buttered and cooked cabbage that just barely covered the vast amount of Corned Beef (1 lb.) that was heaped on the platter.  An abundant supply of boiled Potatoes were al dente and perfectly cooked, as well.   The others at my table enjoyed a full order of Fish & Chips and Shepherd's Pie.  There was a wait of about 13 minutes between being given menus and the return of our server to take orders, and we had a movie to get to.  Otherwise service was good.  5 stars for the Corned Beef & Cabbage, and 4-1/2 stars overall!

Night bartenders tonight were so rude and uncalled for. I feel disrespected even though I brought half of the bar in tonight just to relax and have fun, and then to be treated badly by a rude bartender is uncalled for. he's lucky im old enough to pay my tab an walk away.. never again.

We seem to go to Three Angry Wives when one of us is returning from McCarran.  I don't know why, since it's nowhere near the airport!  Last night was no exception.  It's a new menu, which usually means higher prices.  I think the entrees are higher, but the sandwiches and wraps don't seem to have gone up much, if at all.  Hubby and I shared a Romaine and Spinach Chopped Salad with BBQ chicken breast, avocado, tomato.  The salad was excellent, with moist, warm chicken.  We also shared a Paslawmi Sandwich - a grilled garlic French roll piled high with flavorful, lean pastrami, cheese, and cole slaw.  The hubster wanted potato salad, so I indulged him; I usually don't like most potato salads, but a taste of this one made me want more.  Service was excellent from Kandi, our server, who's been there since the place opened.  She certainly had plenty of patience, since we took forever to decide what we wanted.  I sure hope business is better earlier in the evening; as usual, after the one other table left, we closed the dining room.  I would hate to see this place leave.  Great food, great service, and regular coupons in the newspaper.  What more could you want??

Worst service ever! This only for the bar section. My boyfriend decide to give this bar a try since it's down the street from our house.  1st problem at the bar. They had sign on the machine ( if you're not gambling don't sit here ) 2nd normally if you gamble you get your drink comp ( not here ) 3rd bartender who said his the manager ( mixed guy with dreadlock work on April 3rd at night )  the rudest person I have ever encounter. When my boyfriend asked him a simple question aren't drinks comp when gambling? The manager responded that we did not gamble enough  to get a round of drinks. It's mostly his attitude  the way came off.  He's response was what are you going to do about the charge on the drink and to leave. Ok we only ask a question? This place is a rip off and lacks service. Don't go to this bar save your money.

Oh my God I want to die!  I just ate the Shepard's Pie.  It was so good but I could only finish half of it.   The food in this place is good the prices are great!  It's a definite must for anyone that likes a good Irish Pub!

Came to Three Angry Wives this time to try out the restaurant (smoke free!!!!) side of this lovely establishment. That means, I showed up sober and before 9PM. GO ME! Anyways, this also happen to coincide with my mission to find a new great blue cheeseburger now that Create [RIP] is gone. First of all, they totally love having kids here (not so much on the bar side). The waitress was awesome and super nice. She was attentive all night and made small talk with the small adults (my term for kids). 5 stars for the customer service. The food was alright. When I was inebriated and had taken part in their potato skins, I would've said it was the greatest thing anyone has made anywhere on earth. But the blue cheeseburger was just okay. I think it just didn't have what I think a blue cheeseburger should have: blue cheese, a good all-beef patty, spinach, garlic aioli, raw red onions and bacon. If someone could open a restaurant and make that, I would greatly appreciate it. Thanks. Until then, the search continues....

Would be 5 stars if I didn't have to deal with cigarette smoke...but it is a bar.  First time visitors for happy hour, and the food was good and the price was great! Beware, the nacho appetizer is huge! We will be coming back!
Good service, food was good, beer selection ok... Nice atmosphere. 2 friends and I stayed long enough to come home to 3 angry wives!

Irish bar that offers up breakfast, lunch and dinner!  Went on Sunday morning because it is a NEW ENGLAND PATRIOTS bar during their games. Tons of tvs throughout the bar to watch the number one football franchise on the planet!  They did throw on two other games, just in case, there were any non-Patriots fans.   Full menu is offered and during the game they offer up "football specials" including New England clam chowda and Lobstah Rolls (which were awesome)! In the third quarter they had a raffle where they gave away Patriots paraphernalia.  There is nothing like visiting from Boston and starting my football Sunday with an egg white omelette and sucking it back w a fresh poured Guinness! Patrons are friendly and will even deal with and treat non-Pats fans well.    Service was excellent and Pricing was reasonable. Uber and taxi service readily available.  The only issue I had was walking out of the bar and having to adjust my eyes to the bright sunlight... but adjusted quickly enough after a huge Pats Win!

I've been coming here for most of my life. Good people and great food. I always get their Sheppard's pie or BBQ Chopped salad. Amazing quality for the price. Family owned and a regular spot in Summerlin for many years.

Good food, good service, good music. There's a sign as soon as you enter asking you to sit wherever you like, so not sure why the reviewers from 9 days ago stood at the door for 15 minutes. :) Anyhow, we picked our spot and a server came right over. We asked for menus, which she promptly brought over. We ordered chicken-fried pork chop and wings with fries, Blue Moon for drinks. Everything was very good. Music was a good mix of alternative rock. We will definitely be back. PS - The only negative I have is the wood chairs are a little hard on the backside. But the seats were much more comfy at the bar when we moved over after dinner. We were glad our bartender was nice, the other one did look a little pissy. :)
